Class Critter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Critter

  • public class Critter
extends java.lang.Object
    The Critter class is the class that creates the actual critter.
    Version:
    3 05.29.15

    name: Critter.java

    Instance variables:

    stomachAn ArrayList of Food objects that stores the food that the critter is fed.

    fullness[]An array of 3 integers that stores the fullness level of the critter for each of the three meals.

    foodGroupCount[][]A 2D array of 3 rows and 5 columns that stores the total nutrient value of a certain food group consumed for a certain meal.

    colour This String variable is used to store the critter's colour.

    growthStage This int variable is used to store the level of growth the critter is at currently.

    isHealthy This boolean variable is used to see if the critter is healthy or not.

    Author:
    Jasmine Ou and Laura Wong

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Critter(java.lang.String colour)
      The Critter constructor creates a critter sitter with the specified colour.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Critter

        public Critter(java.lang.String colour)
        The Critter constructor creates a critter sitter with the specified colour.
        Parameters:
        colour - This String variable is used to store the critter's colour.

    • Method Detail

      • getFoodGroupCount

        public int getFoodGroupCount(int meal,
                             int foodGroup)
        The getFoodGroupCount method returns the integer foodGroupCount for the specified meal and food group.
        Parameters:
        meal - is the integer that stores the meal number where 0 is breakfast, 1 is lunch and 2 is dinner.
        foodGroup - is the integer that stores the foodGroup number where O is fruits and vegetables, 1 is grains, 2 is dairy, 3 is protein and 4 is sugars and fats.
        Returns:
        foodGroupCount[][] which is the integer that stores the total nutrient value of a foodGroup consumed for one specific meal.

      • setFoodGroupCount

        public void setFoodGroupCount(int nutrientValue,
                              int meal,
                              int foodGroup)
        The setFoodGroupCount method adds nutrientValue to the foodGroupCount for a specific meal and foodGroup.
        Parameters:
        nutrientValue - is the integer value that stores how much the food item will fill the critter up.
        meal - is the integer that stores the meal number where 0 is breakfast, 1 is lunch and 2 is dinner.
        foodGroup - is the integer that stores the foodGroup number where O is fruits and vegetables, 1 is grains, 2 is dairy, 3 is protein and 4 is sugars and fats.

      • getStomach

        public Food getStomach()
        The getStomach method gets the Food stored in the stomach at a specific index.
        Returns:
        the Food object that was last fed to the critter.

      • addStomach

        public void addStomach(Food food,
                       int meal)
        The addStomach method adds food the the stomach and increments their fullness of a specific meal.
        Parameters:
        food - is the Food object to be added to the stomach.
        meal - is the integer represetning the meal that the nutrientValue should be added to.

      • getFullness

        public int getFullness(int meal)
        The getFullness method gets the integer of the fullness for a specific meal.
        Parameters:
        meal - is the integer that stores the meal number where 0 is breakfast, 1 is lunch and 2 is dinner.
        Returns:
        an integer of the fullness of the critter for a specific meal.

      • getGrowthStage

        public int getGrowthStage()
        the getGrowthStage method is used to get the critter's growth stage.
        Returns:
        growthStage the int variable of the critter's growth stage.

      • setGrowthStage

        public void setGrowthStage(int growthStage)
        the setGrowthStage method is used to set the critter's new growth stage.
        Parameters:
        growthStage - This is the int number of the new growth stage for the critter.
